ca.corefacility.gview.map.inputHandler

Class SelectHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.corefacility.gview.map.inputHandler.SelectHandler

  • public class SelectHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles selection of specific items and features on the GView map.
    Author:
    aaron

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SelectHandler(GViewEventSubjectImp dispatcher)
      Creates a new SelectHandler which fires events to the passed dispatcher.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void multiItemSelect(MapItem item)
      Signals that the passed item was selected, and we are in multi-item select mode.
      void selectOnlyFeatures(DisplayManager displayManager, java.util.Collection<Feature> items)
      Signals that the passed collection of features should be selected (and only these should be selected).
      void selectOnlyFeatures(DisplayManager displayManager, java.util.Collection<Feature> items, boolean fireUpdate)
      Signals that the passed collection of features should be selected (and only these should be selected).
      void singleItemSelect(MapItem item)
      Signals that the passed item was selected, and we are only in single select mode (only selecting a single item).
      void unselectAll()
      Unselects all items that were selected.

      • SelectHandler

        public SelectHandler(GViewEventSubjectImp dispatcher)
        Creates a new SelectHandler which fires events to the passed dispatcher.
        Parameters:
        dispatcher - The dispatcher to use to fire events to.

    • Method Detail

      • singleItemSelect

        public void singleItemSelect(MapItem item)
        Signals that the passed item was selected, and we are only in single select mode (only selecting a single item).
        Parameters:
        item - The item selected.

      • multiItemSelect

        public void multiItemSelect(MapItem item)
        Signals that the passed item was selected, and we are in multi-item select mode.
        Parameters:
        item - The item selected.

      • selectOnlyFeatures

        public void selectOnlyFeatures(DisplayManager displayManager,
                      java.util.Collection<Feature> items)
        Signals that the passed collection of features should be selected (and only these should be selected).
        Parameters:
        items - The collection of features to select. Assumes a selection event should be fired
        displayManager - Used here to find the FeatureItem associated with the given features.

      • selectOnlyFeatures

        public void selectOnlyFeatures(DisplayManager displayManager,
                      java.util.Collection<Feature> items,
                      boolean fireUpdate)
        Signals that the passed collection of features should be selected (and only these should be selected).
        Parameters:
        items - The collection of features to select.
        displayManager - Used here to find the FeatureItem associated with the given features.
        fireUpdate - Determines whether a selection event should be fired. You may not want to fire an event if you are responding to an event

      • unselectAll

        public void unselectAll()
        Unselects all items that were selected.
